alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; James City; Mathews; Middlesex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:08PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gloucester, southeastern Middlesex, northwestern York, Mathews, and James City Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 300 PM EDT... At 207 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Deltaville to near Gloucester Courthouse to near Norge. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Mathews, Gloucester Courthouse, Queens Lake, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Norge, Deltaville, Toano, Gloucester Point, College Of William And Mary, Busch Gardens, Hayes, Carver Gardens, Kings Point, Jamestown, Gwynn, Wicomico, Achilles and Bavon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Gloucester; James City; Mathews; Middlesex; York
